alert.note: Alert for Redwood (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:30PM CDT until April 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Redwood River near Redwood Falls. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Swayback bridge in Redwood Falls overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Wednesday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 04/02/1979. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
